required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identification of Patients With a High Probability of Meeting Eligibility Criteria for an Alzheimer's Disease Clinical Trial (APHELEIA)
clinical_study.official_title: Identification of Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) and Early Alzheimer's Disease (AD) Patients With a High Probability of Meeting Eligibility Criteria for a Therapeutic Alzheimer's Disease Clinical Trial (APHELEIA)

brief_summary.textblock: Apheleia-001 is a prescreener that aims to identify and characterize participants with reported cognitive impairment using demographic information, clinical history, brief cognitive assessments, and blood-based biomarkers to distinguish appropriate participants for referral to a therapeutic AD clinical trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine number of patients eligible for therapeutic Alzheimer's Disease clinical trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study completion, an average of 45 days
primary_outcome.description: Participants with reported memory complaints and/or cognitive impairment will provide demographic information, clinical history, complete brief cognitive assessments, and provide blood-based biomarkers

intervention.description: Identify and characterize participants with reported memory complaints and/or cognitive impairment to determine the probability of randomization into a therapeutic AD clinical trial.

facility.name: Premiere Research Institute at Palm Beach Neurology

reference.citation: Baek MJ, Kim K, Park YH, Kim S. The Validity and Reliability of the Mini-Mental State Examination-2 for Detecting Mild Cognitive Impairment and Alzheimer's Disease in a Korean Population. PLoS One. 2016 Sep 26;11(9):e0163792. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0163792. eCollection 2016.
